level.text: The Criminal Justice Coordinating Council shall include the following members:
Mayor, District of Columbia (Chair);
Chairman, Council of the District of Columbia;
Chairperson, Judiciary Committee, Council of the District of Columbia;
Chief Judge, Superior Court of the District of Columbia;
Chief, Metropolitan Police Department;
Director, District of Columbia Department of Corrections;
Attorney General for the District of Columbia;
Director, Department of Youth Rehabilitation Services;
Director, Public Defender Service;
Director, Pretrial Services Agency;
Director, Court Services and Offender Supervision Agency;
United States Attorney for the District of Columbia;
Repealed;
Director, Federal Bureau of Prisons;
Chair, United States Parole Commission; and
Repealed;
Repealed;
The United States Marshal, Superior Court of the District of Columbia.
Repealed.

level.heading: Section References
level.text: This section is referenced in § 24-1302.

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: The 2013 amendment by D.C. Law 19-320 substituted "Attorney General for the District of Columbia" for "Corporation Counsel for the District of Columbia" in (a)(7); substituted "Department of Youth Rehabilitation Services" for "Department of Human Services' Youth Rehabilitation Services" in (a)(8); repealed (a)(13), (a)(16), and (a)(17); added (a)(18) and made related changes; and repealed (b), which read: "Membership of the Authority members shall expire upon the dissolution of the Authority."

level.heading: Emergency Legislation
level.text: For temporary (90 day) addition of section, see § 1404 of Fiscal Year 2002 Budget Support Emergency Act of 2001 (D.C. Act 14-124, August 3, 2001, 48 DCR 7861).
For temporary amendment of (a) and repeal of (b), see § 106 of the Omnibus Criminal Code Amendments Emergency Amendment Act of 2012 (D.C. Act 19-599, January 14, 2013, 60 DCR 1017).

For temporary (90 days) amendment of this section, see § 106 of the Omnibus Criminal Code Amendment Congressional Review Emergency Act of 2013 (D.C. Act 20-44, April 1, 2013, 60 DCR 5381, 20 DCSTAT 1281).

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 14-28
level.text: For Law 14-28, see notes following § 22-4231.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 19-320
level.text: Law 19-320, the "Omnibus Criminal Code Amendments Act of 2012," was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 19-645. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on Dec. 4, 2012, and Dec. 18, 2012, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on Feb. 11, 2013, it was assigned Act No. 19-677 and transmitted to Congress for its review. D.C. Law 19-320 became effective on June 19, 2013.
